Welcome to Kunu Coffee Huntersville, a specialty coffee bar located just inside Lake Forest Huntersville. We're here to spread positive vibes around Lake Norman, NC through artisanal coffee and tea. Our baristas make every drink with precision, using only the highest quality, ethically-sourced beans, locally sourced A2 milks and organic syrups.
Whether you're working remote or need a place to bring the kids, Kunu Coffee is your go-to spot to jump start your weekday morning or brighten up your weekend. Order ahead on the app to skip the line and have your order ready for pickup.

Welcome to Kunu Coffee Cornelius, your go-to Cornelius neighborhood cafe. We're here to spread positive vibes around Lake Norman, NC through artisanal coffee and tea. Our baristas make every drink with precision, using only the highest quality, ethically-sourced beans, locally sourced A2 milk and organic syrups. Located on West Catawba in the heart of Cornelius, NC. Whether you're working remote or need a place to bring the kids, our Cornelius cafe swing by for a coffee to start your weekday morning or brighten up your weekend.

Address: 305 McGill Ave NW Bldg. 200, Concord, NC 28027
Description: Gibson Mill Market is a locally-sourced food hall located on the campus of historic Gibson Mill in Concord, NC.
Comments:
Similar to Optimist Hall, but I like this spot way more. It's two stories with fewer stalls, which makes it feel more intimate and less overwhelming. Parking is plentiful and free, and it has a down-to-earth vibe rather than the trendy "you have to try this omg" TikTok energy Optimist has these days.

The market itself is a third place, but within it, you've got Luck Factory Games on the lower level with its own café, board games, bar, and snacks. Then there's Kunu Coffee Co., and if that's not enough, you can walk across the street to Mattie Ruth's Coffee. If you make the drive out here, it's worth it. 

You can hang out all day, grab food, coffee, or tea, relax for a bit, and if you're into it, grab a drink at High Branch Brewing Co., which is on the lower level. It's busy enough on weekends to have good energy, but it never feels crowded, and I love that. This place is awesome.

Address: 305 McGill Ave NW Suite 80, Concord, NC 28027
Description: Luck Factory Games is a board game cafe featuring more than 1,000 board games of all kinds. We serve light bites, desserts, snacks and beverages (including sodas, tea, craft beers, ciders and wine) for customers to enjoy while they play and relax.
Comments: If board games are your thing, you will love this place. It's inside the already huge Gibson Mill Market, yet they've carved out a dedicated gaming space that's plenty large on its own. They have their own café with drinks, food, snacks, and every board game you can imagine. You can stop by just to hang out or check their website for opportunities to join meetups or reserve their event space. I love seeing people create spaces like this, fully dedicated to their "thing." We have a brewery on every corner in greater Charlotte, so I'm overjoyed to see this board game café put effort into being a cozy hangout spot.

Description: Espresso drinks, light fare & sweet treats offered in a modern, laid-back space with patio seating.
Comments:
They've got a lot more than just coffee. Tea, sandwiches, ice cream, pastries, smoothies, and bagels, to name a few. The seating layout is cozy, with enough space to feel confident about finding a spot on most days. It's tucked along the sides, so you always have a wall nearby to anchor you. Sitting in a spot with open space on all four sides can feel weird. Having a wall nearby somehow feels safer, and here, every seat is by a wall, which is nice.

The atmosphere is relaxed. Dim lighting, some sofa seating, a covered outdoor area, and a great Christian music playlist in the background. Great spot, popular with Harrisburg locals.

Description: Monarch Market is a destination for crafted culinary experiences in the center of Uptown Charlotte featuring 13 vendors, 1 full-service restaurant, 3 bars and private event space.
Comments: A swanky spot inside One Independence Center with plenty of seating, a wide range of food options, and Wi-Fi (just ask a staff member for the password). It’s internally connected to Coco and the Director and the Marriott hotel, giving you even more seating and coffee options, just walk down the long hallway toward the reception desk to find it. There’s also plenty of outdoor seating. Popular with bank workers in the area.

Description: A community-focused, Black and woman-owned coffee shop in Charlotte, NC, known for its thoughtfully crafted beverages, including unique specialty lattes and teas, fresh pastries, and community events. The shop offers a welcoming, cozy atmosphere and provides a gathering space for relaxation, productivity, and connection, with an emphasis on cultural experiences and local community support.
Comments:
Re-opened in September 2025 after having to move from their previous location when the brewery they shared space with closed down. They’re now in the spot that used to be Queen City Grounds. There’s plenty of seating thanks to the upstairs loft. If it’s packed downstairs, head upstairs and you should be able to find something. There’s solid outlet access up there too, and some good corners downstairs as well.

What I love most here is the massive selection of loose-leaf teas. There's a reason why "Tea" appears first in the business name. There's well over 20 options, ranging from black to oolong to green to herbal. It'd take some time to try them all, which is an incentive to keep coming back here. As someone that's been to nearly every coffee shop in Charlotte despite not drinking coffee (I go for the vibes), I deeply appreciate this place putting some respeck on tea.

Also, the owner must really love plants because there are plants everywhere. Real ones, the kind that need sunlight and water. It gives the shop a completely different vibe and feel than when it was Queen City Grounds, and I like it. There’s artwork on the walls too, including a mural of flowery-looking stuff on the back wall near the restrooms.

Parking is paid, either on the street or in the garage behind the building that’s shared with the apartments. This is a solid place to work remotely in Uptown. I’d put it up there with Coco and the Director in terms of the layout giving you enough space to find a spot and good access to outlets.

Description:
Sustainability is the driver and focus of our coffee concept. Quality, ethical sourcing, and flavor are the criteria we search for when identifying local roasters to source our coffee beans. Featuring carefully curated coffee, tea, and juices, our expansive menu is reflective of the never-ending search for rich flavors and uncompromising quality. Our goal is to foster a community network of local business where people can develop an appreciation for local products. Choosing local roasters supports our community and guarantees the quality and freshness of our menu items.

There’s something special about the ritual of grabbing a fresh cup of coffee to get your day started or catching up with friends in our beloved Community.
Comments:
Small, compact interior with some outdoor seating for extra options. It has that modern coffee shop aesthetic. Pristine and bright, with white floors and walls accented by pops of black. They offer a few cool cookie and pastry options alongside coffee and tea. 

Behind the counter, a short hallway leads to a cozy pair of sofas by a window, a great spot to relax and watch the cars go by. It's also a solid choice for a date since it's tucked behind a wall, giving you a little privacy, just the two of you 👀. 

They serve Rishi tea, which is top-tier as far as bagged teas go. I should mention that despite running this website, which aims to list nearly every coffee shop in Charlotte (since most are third places), I don't actually drink coffee. I'm a tea guy. So I can't tell you how the coffee is, but the vibes are 🔥.

Description: Nestled in the heart of Charlotte, NC, Gotcha Matcha & Espresso is not just your average coffee shop; it's a haven for those seeking a delightful blend of traditional and modern coffee and tea creations. Our passion for quality, creativity, and commitment to serving the finest beverages sets us apart as a unique and inviting destination for caffeine aficionados and tea enthusiasts. Our coffee shop's menu is a fusion of classic and innovative flavors. From rich, handcrafted espresso beverages to vibrant and earthy matcha concoctions, there's something to please every palate.
Comments: Small spot inside a larger building that houses other businesses as well. Within its section and the building at large, there’s enough seating to feel reasonably confident of snagging a spot. In the heart of Uptown, so paid parking, but plenty to explore. Worth an Uptown day trip, make this one of several stops in the area!

Description: A Cause for Tea is a tea house and fundraising initiative that empowers women and children worldwide, demonstrating God’s love one teacup at a time. We support nonprofits like New Life Nicaragua and HELP Pregnancy Resource Center, working with local leaders to provide advocacy, training, and resources to break the cycle of poverty.
Comments:
As a tea lover, I was elated (SAT vocab out here 💪🏾) to find this spot. It's a charming tea house, set in a beautifully decorated historic home, with a blend of Southern charm and English tea traditions. It has a cozy and inviting atmosphere, with mismatched China and a vast selection of teas. It's best to visit during off-peak hours to avoid long wait times, as it can get quite busy, especially on weekends.

Try the scones, chicken pot pie, and the resplendent (💪🏾) cherry almond tea. It's absolutely worth the drive from Charlotte if you're into tea, just get there early on the weekends. They also have a great missions as a business, check out their website for more details.

Description: KB’s Coffee is located just off of Hwy 74 and offers a large selection of specialty coffee and drinks! Hungry for a muffin or pastry? We have that too! Stop by and see us, you will be glad you did.
Comments:
A quintessential cozy community coffee shop. In addition to coffee, they have plenty of pastries, including cinnamon rolls from time to time 🔥🙌🏾. 

On weekends, you’ll find groups of women who look like they could’ve been cast in Steel Magnolias hanging out here. The church aunties. The community grandmas. This is their go-to spot, and it’s an excellent choice. Good coffee, great pastries, comfortable chairs, warm lighting, and enough space to find a corner for a private conversation. A third place indeed.

Description: Beer , wine, espresso, snacks, toys and fun!! A gathering place for everyone.
Comments:
If you’ve ever been to Common Market, this has the same vibe. A deli with convenience store options and a bar. It even shares a similar punk rock aesthetic, complete with an excellent playlist, cool stickers, and eclectic art throughout. There’s plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors, but outlet access is limited, so come charged up.

The food is good, with interesting sandwich options, even down to their names. Wi-Fi is available, the info is posted on a small sign above the trash can near the nonalcoholic drinks case, or you can just ask the staff. If you’re making the trip from Charlotte, take some time to explore Monroe. This spot is in their downtown, which is highly walkable and full of interesting places to check out.

Description: Sorella Coffee is located in Historic Downtown Monroe. Serving Craft Coffee, Pastries, and Housemade Syrups.
Comments:
Lively and bright atmosphere. White walls and furniture with pink accents here and there, plus an unfinished floor, giving it a stylish yet approachable feel. Very TikTok influencer-friendly. There's a spacious upstairs area with excellent outlet access. It turns into a pop-up shop for local businesses on weekends, so you can browse while you sip your coffee.

The shop is in downtown Monroe, a highly walkable area with plenty to explore. A local I met during my visit highly recommended Main Street Bistro next door, as well as Oasis Sandwich Shop across the street, known for their hot dogs and cash-only policy. Parking is free in the city lot down the street, though there are some day and time restrictions depending on when you visit.

Description: High Octane Coffee Creamery Eatery is the newest Union County’s Newest and Hottest Foodie Location. Offers 100% Specialty Colombian Coffee, Hersheys Ice Cream, Sandwiches, pastries, smoothies,parfaits and acai bowls.
Comments:
The name comes from the building’s history as an old gas station, and with it comes a repurposed industrial aesthetic. Not industrial chic, just straight-up industrial, with everything needed to run a coffee shop, bakery, and ice cream shop all in one.

The bakery has cinnamon rolls🔥🙌🏾. And they're of a quality rivaling some of the regions best. It’s a large, generously iced masterpiece with frosting that somehow tastes like vanilla ice cream. I don’t know how they did it, but I’ve never had anything like it. And because of that, it’s just as good cold as it is warm. Ingenious. Bravo to the baker.

There’s a moderate amount of indoor seating, but if you can’t snag a spot, there’s lots outside too. On warm weekends, a pop-up boutique sets up outside, selling clothes and various trinkets.

Description: We may not be a big fancy coffee house but we have a lot of love and compassion for our customers and community. Alice Jules coffeehouse “Where the coffee is brewed especially for YOU”
Comments:
This is in a house with an English countryside aesthetic to it. Exceptionally cozy, comfortable chairs, dim lighting, a royal maroon color on the walls, vases on the countertops, art all about, and I’m not sure if it’s incense, a candle, or their coffee, but the whole place smells marvelous.

Small interior but there’s plenty of outdoor seating, with more a very short walk away at Gateway Park. Great place to grab a coffee then sit outside on a warm day. There’s also an antique store right by it that has some interesting finds. It’s a cool area in general, far from cookie-cutter.

Address: 4705 Indian Trail Fairview Rd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Description: Here at Rockhounds Coffee, our goal is to introduce great-tasting, locally roasted coffee to the Ice Rink! Come check it out on weekend mornings!
Comments:
This spot is inside Extreme Ice Center, even if nothing outside hints at that, you're in the right place. When you enter, make a right and walk down the hallway past the vending machines. You’ll find the coffee shop set up as a concession-style stand just before the restrooms. It’s a legit standalone coffee shop, just tucked inside a larger arena.

The shop itself is small, but the building is huge, with plenty of space to explore, sit, and spread out. There’s a pub upstairs (stairs are on the opposite end of the building from the coffee shop) serving food, drinks, and all the usual pub fare, plus a golf simulator up there as well.

A hidden gem. Free Wi-Fi, free parking, small coffee shop, but a massive space. The only catch is checking the center’s schedule. Saturdays are packed with hockey games, making it a rough day to visit. But when there’s no game, this spot is cool.

Description:
At Mado, everything is homemade from scratch. We bring the true taste of France to the Carolinas with authentic French pastries, artisan breads, and specialty drinks.

🍰 Desserts & Pastries: Tarts, choux, and entremets, perfect for a sweet treat or celebration.

🥐 Viennoiseries: Buttery croissants (classic, chocolate, almond, apple… and more).

🍞 Artisan Breads: Sourdough baguettes, brioche, and savory bread, made with traditional French flour.

☕ Drinks: espresso, flavored lattes, cold-pressed French juices.

🏙️ Perfect for a coffee date, business meeting, or fresh-baked bread to take home.

📍 Rock Hill, SC | Serving the Charlotte, NC area
Comments:
A French bakery that, to me, feels closer to authentic French pastries than our beloved Charlotte staple, Amélie's. The croissants, in particular, are incredibly buttery, flaky, and just downright good. No cinnamon rolls, but to be fair, they’re not a traditional French pastry. They’re staying authentic, and I respect that.

The space has a rustic aesthetic, featuring a fireplace and a massive vault door that I can only assume was once part of a bank. Now, it houses a pair of couches and a coffee table. An interesting touch for sure. Compared to Charlotte’s more ritzy, modern cafés, this one feels refreshingly down-to-earth, in the best way possible.

Description:
Borboleta Café is a vibrant, community-focused coffee shop located in the heart of Rock Hill, SC. Our mission is to create a welcoming, safe space where coffee lovers can connect, grow, and be inspired. We proudly serve high-quality, locally roasted coffee from Pure Intentions and offer a menu full of carefully crafted espresso drinks, teas, fresh pastries, and more. 

Whether you're looking to fuel your day with a delicious cup of coffee, attend one of our financial literacy workshops, or simply enjoy a cozy corner to relax- Borboleta Café is here to nourish your body and mind.
Comments:
Tropical aesthetic with plenty of plants, both real and painted on the walls. Bright and energetic vibe, making it a solid spot for working, studying, and staying awake. There’s a moderate amount of seating. Not a lot, but enough that you can feel reasonably confident about finding a spot if you go during a non-peak time. 

But most importantly, they have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯. And not just any cinnamon rolls. These are sourdough-based with cream cheese frosting. I believe they’re from a local bakery, and they’re good. Surprisingly, they taste better cold than warm, though they’re great either way. Cream cheese frosting tends to struggle with heat. It’s a delicate science to get the right temperature without it melting into a soupy mess on the plate. Anyways, great spot.

Address: 1177 Stonecrest Blvd Suite 104, Tega Cay, SC 29708
Description: Tega Cay Coffee Company is open for business! We are happy to announce our storefront at 1177 Stonecrest Blvd - We look forward to serving you the absolute best coffee around!
Comments: Modern cabin aesthetic with good outlet access. It’s small, so it can feel cramped when it gets super busy, but on weekdays, it’s usually not overwhelming. Solid breakfast food. It's next to a nicer Walmart, as far as Walmart's go, so easy anxiety-free shopping is just around the corner after hanging out here.

Description: Welcome to Vavela Cafe! We are a Turkish style coffee shop located in Charlotte, NC. Our coffee is brewed using the traditional Turkish method, which results in a rich and flavorful cup of coffee. We only use the highest quality beans, and our coffee is always fresh and delicious.
Comments:
One of Charlotte's most beautiful coffee shops. If you've been to Haraz or Qahwah House, it's similar, but in my opinion, better than both, in terms of design, not the coffee.

The decor is fully Turkish/Middle Eastern-inspired, with golden accents, vibrant colors, plants scattered throughout, and hanging bookshelves adorning the ceilings on the far ends. The walls are covered with emblems and engravings, there's a spacious patio in addition to a spacious indoor area. There's also a coffee bean tree-looking centerpiece that looks cool.

They serve coffee, tea, food, pastries, and some seriously good cheesecake. The two long tables inside offer good access to outlets, but the seating can be awkward. The chairs are tightly packed near the plants, making it difficult to reach your seat without stepping over others unless you're seated at the ends. 

There's no way the owners of Haraz, Coffee Origin, and Qahwah House don't know about this place, because they're clearly all competing for the best Middle Eastern-style café in Charlotte. And as far as aesthetics go? I think this one wins.

Description: Casual, counter-serve outpost offering sandwiches & desserts plus bubble tea drinks in many flavors.
Comments: Lovely calming atmosphere, bright and floral aesthetic, great background music, friendly staff, unique bubble tea options and food. It's right by Vavela Cafe, which is amazing aesthetically, so definitely check that out as well.

Place: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library | University City Regional
Address: 5528 Waters Edge Village Drive, Charlotte, NC 28262
Description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.
Comments:
New as of 2025 and gorgeous. Bright, open, and airy with wall-sized windows letting in tons of natural light. The second floor has a great views of the surrounding areas, plenty of seating with tons of outlets, and a good number of study rooms if you need quiet focus or a spot to take calls.

You’ll see a lot of remote workers camped out on the second floor, while the first floor is more kid-focused, which works out perfectly. There’s plenty of space for everyone to enjoy without being on top of each other. Just an all-around beautiful library.

Description: One cup at a time, brewing daily, great coffee and pastries.
Comments:
Has a cozy, upscale cabin sort of aesthetic. Along with the usual options, they serve Turkish, Vietnamese, and Cuban-style coffee, plus flavors like butterscotch, blueberry, amaretto, and butter pecan. A moderate amount of seating, but it's compact. If anyone's having a conversation, everyone can hear them, making noise cancelling headphones a must if you're looking to study/work. 

Lots of cool Christian-themed art and inspirational quotes on the walls. It strikes a balance between feeling like an authentic local coffee shop while still having a modern touch in its design. Great spot. If you visit, also check out New Asia Market around the corner. Inside, there’s a quality Chinese food spot, and the store is packed with snacks, candies, spices, teas, and specialty foods from various Asian cultures, some of which you won’t even find at Super G Mart. A true hidden gem!

Description: Specialty coffee, local pastries, craft beer & wine.
Comments:
The space has a sort of contemporary yet regal aesthetic to it. Teal walls with gold accents and warm colors on the furniture and decorations. It’s by an apartment complex, so while there’s free parking, the spots are almost always taken by residents. Paid street parking is available nearby though. 

There's a moderate amount of seating, including some outdoor options and a picnic table area belonging to the apartments but accessible to all. Summit Coffee is in general a great Charlotte local chain. They have a unique birthday cake cookie. It has frosting piled in the center rather than spread to the edges, so you have to eat your way to it, almost like a reward. They also offer more creative tea options than most coffee shops.

Description: Neighborhood café located in an apartment complex. Offers expertly brewed coffee, pastries, and a lofted workspace.
Comments:
Feels like a hidden gem. Hardly ever busy, maybe it hasn't been discovered yet by the IG/TikTok Charlotte coffee shop crowd. For that reason, it's very chill, and the music is amazing. Whoever chooses the playlist does an excellent job. Calming indie, easy listening, classic rock, a few pop hits here and there, all good clean, happy, vibrant, fun vibes.

This is attached to a newer (as of 2025) apartment complex called Elan LoSo. It's giving "posh, elegant, modern". But say all those words in a French accent. A mix of crisp whites, natural greens with plants here and there, and gold accents on the light fixtures. Bravo to the interior designer of this place. The aesthetic is lovely.

The upstairs area is part of the coffee shop, and it's a gem. It's small, only 3 seating options, but they've adorned the overhang with plants, there's a restroom, it's carpeted, and 2 of the 3 seating options have outlet access. The coziest of cozy nooks. If you can get an upstairs spot, good for you. Downstairs is nice as well, a few two-person tables, couches, and coffee bar seating with outlets.

Parking is tight, it's around the corner in a garage, paid and 2-hour limited. But there's a few street spots (you'll have to parallel park) that are free and not time limited. Overall, a lovely coffee shop. There's another Night Swim around the corner on Old Pineville Road that's bigger, so if you can't find a spot (or parking) here, mosey on over there.

Description: A family-run bakery founded by self-taught baker Cristina Rojas, also known as “The Batchmaker.” Inspired by her Honduran roots and a love for serving others, Cris crafts fresh cakes, brownies, cookies, and more—often paired with a cup of coffee sourced from her family’s farm. Drop by for a warm welcome, sweet treats, and a taste of home-baked goodness.
Comments:
This comment is courtesy of a friend (shout out JL). Founded by a Honduran with a great story and a generous heart. They donate all leftover pastries to public servants like teachers, firefighters, and police. 

It’s small, dainty, and has a super feminine, dollhouse aesthetic with teacups galore. The coffee cake, Oreo cookies, and raisin cookies are all verified hits. And the cinnamon rolls! Most seating is outside, so a good option for a warm day. The Wi-Fi extends outside. 

Also, Platform Coffee + Kitchen is in the complex, giving you another solid third place within walking distance.

Address: 1031 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd Suite B, Matthews, NC 28105
Description:
Locally owned café and coffee bar offering breakfast, lunch and custom crafted coffees in our relaxing dine-in space and outside patios. Our menu features made to order omelets, bagels, breakfast sandwiches, grain bowls, empanadas, burgers, wraps, and salads as well as vegetarian options and many café classics. 

Our espresso bar uses locally roasted, sustainably sourced beans from Magnolia Coffee in our Nitro, cold brew, specialty coffee drinks and retail whole bean coffees. We also serve protein shakes, frappes, smoothies, and fitness drinks. Are you looking to host an event or party? Come check out our venue spaces inside our café and neighboring co-work. We also offer full-service catering through our sister company TreeTop Catering.
Comments:
The food here is great, the burgers, empanadas, and fries are all hits. The fries in particular are incredible, very crispy. Also, they at times provide two different cinnamon roll options, a butter cream icing and a traditional icing. Words can hardly express how deeply I appreciate that.

I love this place. Seating is spread out, shouldn't be hard to find somewhere to sit even during peak hours, but access outlet can be challenging so come charged up.

Description: La Dolcekca Bakery Cafe offers fresh custom cakes, gourmet coffee, and all-day meals, with the Tres Leches pastry as a standout favorite. It's a warm, welcoming spot designed to be part of your daily routine.

Address: 2023 Beatties Ford Rd Suite D, Charlotte, NC 28216
Description: Archive CLT is a Black owned book cafe in Charlotte NC. We offer local roasted coffee and espresso along with your favorite nostalgic books, magazines and relics.
Comments:
You could drop this spot right into Brooklyn and it'd fit right in. It's black owned, black themed, and very cool. The walls are decked with black history, culture, art, and icons. There's a live DJ sometimes playing music Mos Def would approve of.

You can catch a group of Bernie Mac/Cedric the Entertainer brand old heads in here on some weekends in barbershop mode, just chilling. If Dr. Umar (iykyk) ever came to Charlotte this is where he'd want to hang out. Its unapologetically black. It's worth visiting just for the vibes. If you haven't caught on by now I—the creator of this site—am black—and proud!

Description: A family-run, Black-owned coffee shop located in Uptown Charlotte’s Queen City Quarter. Serving coffee, specialty drinks, pastries, and light meals, it provides a welcoming space for people to gather and relax.
Comments: Great spot to grab some food/coffee, work, study, or just chill in a cozy environment. It has that true family vibe, don’t be surprised if the owner or a family member stops by for a friendly chat. The pastries, particularly the donuts, are incredible. That's because they source them from Beyond Amazing Donuts, another local black-owned business, and a favorite of mine (they have marvelous cinnamon rolls). That plus the laid-back atmosphere makes it a great place to hangout!

Description: Visart Cafe offers a variety of coffee drinks, sodas, beer, wine. We also have hot food, charcuterie boards, local pastries and more! The cafe includes a pet friendly garden and access to the Visart theater!
Comments:
This place is so cool. Vintage vibes all around. It's attached to a video store that rents and sells VHS tapes, DVDs, and Blu Rays. The cafe is an extension of that, serving coffee, tea, hot food, pastries, and other snack like items. They even have cinnamon rolls sometimes 🔥.

When you arrive, the big sign says "Visart Video" but that's not where you enter for the cafe. Go around the corner down the long walkway, you'll pass a bunch of tables and chairs. That's a good chunk of the seating, outside, but there’s additional seating indoors through a door you pass walking in.

The indoor area has this dark room, film auteur, sort of vibe. Movie posters all around, various art pieces, very cool. There's a mini movie theater that's down to earth. Nothing fancy, a simple small screen, individual chairs, that aren't particularly comfortable but are enough to sit and enjoy a film. 

If you get there early enough in the day, they'll let you pick a movie to put on. I got to watch Things We Lost in the Fire (featuring Halle Berry & Benicio Del Toro, a beautifully moving drama) and Reign of Fire (featuring Christian Bale & Matthew McConaughey, an underrated turn your brain off film) on a rainy Wednesday morning while half-working on my laptop in a corner. I don't know any other third places in Charlotte where you can do that!

This is also a great place to hang out if it's warm, there’s outlets outdoors. It’s right by an awesome local bookstore, Book Buyers, so you can get your drinks, browse the video store, and then browse the bookstore, all within walking distance. And a final story, the first time I visited, a dude had the indoors booked to propose to his girlfriend. She was elated, I suspect they met here. So, it could be said the vibes here are...lovely ❤️.

Description:
At Platform Coffee, we're all about building community and creating connections. From your first interaction to your last sip, you'll feel the warmth and joy that great coffee can bring. 

With our roastery located right here on-site, we’re able to serve freshly roasted coffee with unmatched quality and care. Our passionate team is dedicated to genuine hospitality in a welcoming atmosphere like no other, come experience it for yourself!
Comments:
They have cinnamon rolls 🔥. Parking can be tough during peak hours as there's a bunch of other businesses nearby. They've got some serious food options, so if you want a meal with your coffee/tea this is a good spot to hangout. 

Good access to outlets if you sit on bench seating side. Very relaxed, bright, welcoming, atmosphere. Lots of outdoor seating, and the Wi-Fi works out there, so a great spot to work/study on a warm day. 

The Batch House, a cute bakery with a dollhouse aesthetic, is in the same complex. Definitely check it out on your visit here, they have cinnamon rolls!

Place: Night Swim Coffee | Old Pineville Road
Description: Specialty coffee shop from a local Charlotte roaster serving carefully crafted espresso drinks, drip coffee, and rotating single origin offerings, along with a small selection of pastries. Known for consistent quality, attention to detail, and baristas who can help you choose something new, it is a reliable stop whether you are grabbing a quick coffee or exploring more adventurous seasonal drinks.
Comments: The cinnamon sugar bagel is very good, they give you a generous amount of cream cheese, almost too much, which is marvelous. They have a solid tea menu, not an overwhelming amount of choices, but the ones they have are a step above your standard tea options. If you order tea "for here," they serve it in a nice mug with a little glass pitcher for extra tea, a plate, and sometimes even a gold-colored spoon. Very quaint, very posh, very...demure?

Description: Contemporary spot serving high-end coffee drinks, plus tea & light fare like toasts & yogurt.
Comments: This has to be the biggest Not Just Coffee in the city. I grew up in Seattle, this spot reminds me of coffee shops over there. You've got a crowd of very cool looking young people, hipsters, and then your professionals, all on their laptops, working, drinking coffee, and pausing here and there to socialize. This is like the coffee shop capital of South End, it embodies the vibe of the neighborhood perfectly. I like the hot tea options they provide, more creative than your standard options.

Description: Our vision for Waterbean Coffee is to create an environment where we are more than just another coffee shop. We’d love for you to think of us as an extension of your home or business.
Comments:
This used to be the beloved spot Unwind Tea & Coffee before it was bought by Waterbean. The new Waterbean opened in the Fall of 2022, and while it doesn't have the same decor as Unwind, it maintains the respect the former had for tea.

They have a shelf with at least 20 tea options in small demo canisters that you can pick up and smell to make your choice. The interior setup makes great use of the space, plenty of spots for individual seating plus a few larger tables for groups. It's always weird sitting at a table meant for four when you're just there to study or work on your laptop alone. You won't have that problem here.

Great access to outlets, big windows that let in a lot of light, and a really good sandwich called the Waterbean Special, try it! I'm a regular here, it's one of my favorite spots in the city.

Address: 11318 N Community House Rd #202, Charlotte, NC 28277
Description: In 2019, I started Millbridge Cake in my Waxhaw kitchen, creating fresh, less-sweet cakes and desserts like those I made for my family. After four years of word-of-mouth growth, I expanded into ‘Littl Madeleine,’ a charming Korean cafe offering madeleines, scones, cookies, cheesecakes, and other Korean treats. At Littl ♡ Madeleine, every madeleine, scone, cookie, and cake is crafted exclusively with organic flour, organic sugar, organic milk, organic honey, organic eggs, AA-grade butter, and pure heavy cream. We handcraft everything in small batches, ensuring it’s fresh and real, and only make what we truly love, so we can confidently recommend each item to our customers. Gratefully, Sadie
Comments:
A standout among the many coffee shops and bakeries in Charlotte. While they don't have cinnamon rolls 😞, they have very unique cheesecakes that are worth trying. There always seems to be a few couples on dates here, and I can see why. It's got that cute, clean, minimalist aesthetic: all white with subtle pops of color, like a doctor's office but way cozier. The kind of interior that TikTok/Instagram influencers would love.

It's also laptop friendly with solid outlet access and some small tables fit for one or two. I like that most of the seating is blocked by walls so that you can't see the order area. So when people are waiting in line, standing around, checking out the bakery, if you're seated you mostly can't see them. That's such a good interior design thing to me. Reducing visual clutter for guests that want to lounge about.

Address: 793 W Charlotte Ave, Mt Holly, NC 28120
Description: Nestled in the heart of the community, Passion’s Café & Pastry is a cozy haven where locals and visitors alike come together to enjoy freshly brewed coffee and delectable pastries.
Comments:
You know that hot pink and green crochet hook they sell at Sally Beauty that hairdressers use for braids? The aesthetic here reminds me of that, like the colors match almost exactly. This comment might only make sense if you’re black lol. My Mom braided my sisters hair so I saw that crochet hook a lot, and had to go fetch it plenty of times.

The actual store is small but nice, lots of food options, and pastries. I couldn’t find Wi-Fi during my brief visit, but ask the staff if you go, maybe they have it. If they do, let me know via the Contribute page.

Description: SipCha is a locally owned bubble tea shop specializing in fresh fruit teas, premium bubble teas, and daily-made rolled ice creams. Enjoy a relaxed, welcoming environment perfect for chatting and unwinding with friends.
Comments: Great access to outlets, small but connected indoors to Tous les Jours so you’ve got more seating and pastry options nearby.

Address: 13880 E Independence Blvd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: It’s Panera bread, you know what it is. Whatever you may think of them, they’re consistent with designing their stores as friendly places to hang out a while.

Address: 133 Indian Trail Rd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Description:
Raw Crunch and Coffee is a fun, family-owned coffee shop nestled in the heart of Indian Trail, NC. Our coffee and milks are all organic, including our house made syrups. We are the only coffee shop in the nation that is proudly free of "natural flavors"! 

We are also known for our gluten free French crepes and house made Raw Crunch® bars. Coffee in the front, Raw Crunch® bar factory in the back. Whether you're looking for a quick pick-me-up or a relaxing place to unwind, stop by and taste the difference. Let's bring real flavor back!
Comments: Stands out for having really healthy, organic, clean versions of everything you’d expect a coffee shop to have, plus food. Bright aesthetic, very good crepes, inviting atmosphere.

Address: 606 Indian Trail Road South, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Comments: Warm, chill vibes. There’s a digital fireplace that I think is cool, gives the place a relaxing homey feel to it. Pretty calm throughout the day, there’s a good group of regulars but not the overwhelming rush you get at spots closer to the city.

Description: Premium Organic Yemeni Coffee. Specialty High Quality Coffee Imported From Our Own Family Farms!
Comments:
Pristine vibes, immaculate aesthetic, very bright and airy. If you’ve been to Haraz Coffee House, this place is similar, but a lot bigger. It’s Yemeni owned, so the culture, coffee, and aesthetic of the shop reflects that in a beautiful way.

The Khaliat Nahal (Honeycomb Bread) is incredible, it's somehow not as sweet as you'd think, but just sweet enough. Limited access to outlets so come charged up if you’re looking to hangout a while.

Description: A slow moving Monday morning. A fast paced Wednesday lunch break. An easy and pleasant Saturday afternoon. No matter where you are in your week (or your day), you can count on Salted Melon to have exactly what you need, sometimes before you know you need it.
Comments: Coffee, tea, food, drinks, in a clean, bright, bubble gum sort of aesthetic space. Whoever designed the interior is good at designing interiors. My only criticism would be the limited access to outlets. The food is good, the staff is very nice. Free parking, but it can get tight during lunch hours.

Address: 100 W Worthington Ave Suite 107, Charlotte, NC 28203
Description: A slow moving Monday morning. A fast paced Wednesday lunch break. An easy and pleasant Saturday afternoon. No matter where you are in your week (or your day), you can count on Salted Melon to have exactly what you need, sometimes before you know you need it.
Comments:
Cool spot with similar vibes to Rhino Market, coffee, tea, food, bar, bakery, convenience store, all in one. However, this spot leans into being a proper restaurant as well, having a seated section with wait staff, silverware, etc. Very clean, modern, bright aesthetic.

They have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯 and other bakery items that they get from Amelie's. It's South End, so parking is tough. There are free options in the area if you drive around, but the garage attached to this spot is paid, and they don't validate parking. 

In their defense, South End is meant to be a walkable area. The idea is to take the light rail, walk around, shop, explore. So, if you go, take some time to embrace a walkable Charlotte. There are all sorts of spots in this general area.

Description: Sunflour Baking Company is a local bakery with locations in Harrisburg and Charlotte. Founded in 2009, Harrisburg is the newest location to feature fresh made pastries, local brewed coffee, and a great place to meet or hang out. Come visit Sunflour Baking Company today.
Comments:
This is the largest Sunflour Bakery I’ve been to, go through the opening on the far right when you walk in and there’s plenty seating. If I lived closer, this would be my favorite of all their locations. It feels lived in, down to earth, authentic. A tip, if you can’t find parking out front, drive to the street behind the building, there’s more there. And across all their locations, Sunflour Bakery has some of the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte.

The sandwiches are also good, I suggest the Sunny Special on a cheddar biscuit, it’s huge. They also serve Rishi teas, a standout as far as bagged teas go. The orange blossom green tea is 🤌🏾👏🏾. Now, nothing here is cheap. You'll get like 2 things and spend $20, but it all tastes good, so it's worth the splurge every once in a while.

Address: 5910 Waxhaw Hwy Suite D, Mineral Springs, NC 28108
Description: Locally owned and operated coffee shop with local baked goods.
Comments: Quiet and inviting atmosphere that features coffee but also pastries, and most importantly, cinnamon rolls (👏🔥). They open early and close in the afternoons, so if you’re making a day trip from Charlotte, get up on time. It’s worth the trip. Waxhaw is around the corner so you can explore that area as well.

Description: Upscale grocery store chain with an old-world vibe offers local produce, prepared eats, wine & more.
Comments: The store itself is large but the seating area is a small strip of tall chairs against a tall shelf like table running across the checkout area near the restrooms. There’s a microwave in the area to warm up food. Good low key spot in the sense that not many use the seating. Free Wi-Fi, access to everything sold in the store, not a bad setup at all.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This is one of those where they put some effort into the interior design to make it inviting and bright. Excellent access to outlets from seating positions along the windows and walls, and even at the big table in the middle. Sits in a large shopping park with plenty of other things to check out.

Description: The Wandering Cup coffee shop serves locally roasted coffee and local baked goods, located inside of Alchemy Coworking. Proudly serving Night Swim Coffee.
Comments: A cozy storefront in downtown Gastonia, right in the heart of the old town, but with a fresh, modern vibe. Shares the space with Alchemy Coworking, who have plenty of additional seating, but require membership for access. The actual coffee shop's seating area is small but nice. Limited street parking right in front of the shop but there’s lots within walking distance. In addition to good coffee, the staff are known for being really nice here.

Description:
Take a step back in time and enjoy the relaxed shopping experience of the 1920’s General Store, and sit with friends at our cafe, or relax with a good book in a comfortable reading space. Enjoy free Wi-Fi while you spend time with us. We will offer in-house roasted coffees, bulk coffees, teas, spices, oils and vinegars.

Our cafe will offer specialty coffees, teas, soft drinks, and light snacks, such as pastries. In addition, there are a variety of exclusive and reasonably priced items for your entire family. We are open, stop by anytime and visit!
Comments:
A gift shop, roastery, spice store, and coffee shop all in one. Rustic, cozy, vintage, is how I'd describe this place. Free Wi-Fi, decent access to outlets, and a good selection of coffee and tea. 

I'll admit, it took some convincing to get me out to Gastonia, but it's got its own charm. Worth a day trip to the area, after stopping here, you can go shop at the nearby Dillard's Clearance Center (the deals are real) if you're looking to update your wardrobe.

A spacious, swanky atrium with marble floors, high ceilings, and plenty of natural light. It's connected to Bank of America, Blumenthal Performing Arts Center, and the Overstreet Mall. The 2024 redesign added tons of comfy seating and outlet towers so you can easily stay charged. There's several free Wi-Fi options (try another network if one acts up) and a Caribou Coffee for drinks and snacks. The downside is it's Uptown, so no free parking. I'd suggest parking in the Bank of America Corporate Center Garage—take the elevator to the 6th floor, and you’re inside Founders Hall. There's security guards everywhere, to the point where it's like "ayo calm down". They on every corner. You'll never feel safer than you will hanging out here. Upstairs near Caribou there’s a game room open to the public called The Lounge with ping pong, mini golf, a pool table, arcade games, and overpriced snacks. Around the corner from Caribou, you'll find a Post Office, a small library, and a path to the Overstreet Mall with more food options. You can explore most of Uptown indoors via the skywalks that connect the big buildings. This place is totally worth an Uptown day trip. Work/study then explore and go to an evening event (Hornets game, Middle C Jazz, Blumenthal show) to justify the price of parking.

Place: Seoul Food Meat Company | Mill District
Description: Southern BBQ and Korean fusion
Comments: Spacious with plenty of seating indoors and out. During the day, it’s easy to find a quiet corner. There’s a variety of food, drinks, desserts, and even an arcade with karaoke. The wings are seriously good. I'm not saying that flippantly they are actually really good. Right next to Urban District Market (same owners), it's a great remote work/study spot, though outlets are limited. The proximity (literally 30 second walk) makes it easy to switch between the two—park once, enjoy two solid options, both open late.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: Very bright, large windows everywhere, lots of light to keep you energetic if you’re here to work or study. This is one of those with the big long table with outlets in the middle. Then there’s a handful of individual tables to the sides and lounge chairs. It’s in a large shopping complex in a rather ritzy part of town. There’s a Smashburger nearby 👀🔥. Do what you will with that information.

Description: Olive’s Clay Studio and Olive’s Coffee Shop are one and the same business. We are Coffee and Art Studio with Classes. Make an appoint today by email to talk to us!
Comments:
Sits in the historic downtown area of Fort Mill. Eclectic vibes. There are shelves around the store with arts and crafts and various trinkets created by locals. There’s also a piano anyone is welcome to play. Locally owned, serves as a gathering place for various groups, such as ceramics and knitting enthusiasts.

Pretty compact space but they waste none of it. There’s a string of chairs near the piano with outlet access for those bringing their laptop. There’s limited parking right in front, for additional options, park in the Fort Mill Municipal Parking Lot down the street at the stoplight. It’s a short walk to the coffee shop.

Address: 6840 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd, Mint Hill, NC 28227
Description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.
Comments: Very nice, new, modern library. Moderate amount of seating, while the space itself, in terms of square footage, is about medium sized, the actual spots where adults (excluding the kids and teens zone) can sit down could be described as on the smaller side. Despite this, it’s a fine library, as is consistent across Charlotte-Mecklenburg branches.

Address: 900 S Fork Village Dr G4, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: Located in the South Fork Village apartment complex, serving specialty coffee along with locally made baked goods. Proudly serving Night Swim Coffee from Charlotte, N.C. Wander on over to see us soon!
Comments: In addition to coffee and pastries, they have a wonderful selection of teas from the family-owned and operated Piper & Leaf Tea Co in Alabama. Visit their website to learn more about their business story!

Description: As children of Vietnamese immigrant households, we have always been taught the value of food and its great meaning in our daily lives. Our love for Vietnamese cuisine is nurtured by time through the highs and the lows of our parents' cooking, which is why we founded 220C Banh Mi & Coffee as a place where everyone is welcome to hang out and enjoy Vietnamese food made with passion that is accumulated for many generations.
Comments: Small space but great aesthetic. The owners are Vietnamese so in addition to serving food, pastries, and coffee reflecting their culture, they’ve arranged the store the same. The sandwiches and pastries are really good. They have cinnamon rolls (💯🔥). They have hot or cold tea, the hot peach blossom is great. Limited access to outlets. The seating is compact, but it doesn’t get too crowded in the mornings, so come early to secure a spot.

Address: 104 W Charlotte Ave, Mt Holly, NC 28120
Comments: They have various pastries, sometimes cinnamon rolls, but the cream cheese Danish they have regularly is fire. Has a small town rustic coffee shop aesthetic that's delightful. You don't have to park on the street, there's a lot behind the building that's free.

Address: 613 S Main St A, Mt Holly, NC 28120
Description: Fresh coffee and pastries
Comments:
The coffee shop is the door on the left when you enter. Lots of seating, also lots of outlets, all somehow placed in slightly inconvenient locations (look above and below the windows). But at least they're there! 

It's Yemeni owned, the walls are covered in very well done art representing their culture. I think this location used to be a video store, so they did a marvelous job converting the space. There’s Wi-Fi, the password is the name of the store all lowercase, no spaces, and no s at the end of origin. The cheesecakes they sell are all marvelous. They put some bakery level effort into those things.

Description:
The Everyday Market is a community-focused cafe that strives to create simple and delicious made-from-scratch food paired with exceptional coffee.
Taking inspiration from European cafes, The Everyday Market offers a space for the community near and far to relax and escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The team, led by pastry chef / owner Majid Amoorpour, are happy to be part of Belmont’s historic downtown and would love for you to come spend some time with us.

The second Everyday Market location recently opened in the vibrant Lower South End district of Charlotte, NC.
Comments: Lots of food options, coffee, tea, pastries, and various market items for individual purchase. Parking is free but limited in terms of store dedicated spots. There’s additional Belmont downtown parking though. You might have to drive around a bit to find a spot if you go during peak hours, but Belmont is very walkable. I’d say walking around downtown Belmont to get here is a part of the attraction. There’s plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, although it’s popular enough to get crowded around lunch time. There’s a nice park and walking trail across the street. Limited access to outlets, but so long as you’re charged up, it’s a great place to hangout. Start here, eat, drink, then explore Belmont.

Description: The Everyday Market is a community-focused cafe that strives to create simple and delicious made-from-scratch food paired with exceptional coffee.
Comments: Food, coffee, tea, and pastries in a good sized space. Limited access to outlets though, and parking can be tough, really tough. It’s free street parking but there’s so many other businesses in the area and apartments making it challenging to find a nearby spot. It’s worth toughing out though, the foods good, the staff is kind, they have large windows that let in a lot of light. Cool spot.

Description: Long-running store selling & trading a wide, regularly changing selection of books.
Comments: My favorite bookstore in Charlotte. Lot's of space, older building that feels lived-in, authentic. It even smells like a bookstore, idk how it just does. A very expansive book selection, and random chairs in the various corners and crevices so you can sit and read. Awesome place. I wouldn’t suggest going here to work, it’s a proper bookstore, the seating is individual without outlet access or nearby tables. Embrace the book vibes. Read.

Description: Independent bookstore selling new & used books
Comments: The quintessential local bookstore. Connected indoors with Press & Porter Coffee, who in addition to great drinks, have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯.  Get a good book, grab a coffee, find a place to sit between the bookstore and coffee shop. Sounds like a good time to me, speaking from experience.

Description: Good energy, local coffee, craft beer, and CATS, right in the heart of two beautiful historic districts in North Carolina: NoDa, Charlotte and Downtown Concord! Twelve adoptable cats roam the CAT LOUNGE - and they are ready to play! Our CAFE is separate and offers coffee, wine, craft beer and more!
An independent bookstore in east Charlotte, offering a carefully curated selection of adult fiction and other genres.
Comments: Lovely little bookstore. Seating exists as a few tables and chairs by the front windows and a set of closely compacted couches. So not quite a remote work spot, but I encourage an embrace of literature. Leave your laptop behind and come here to read!

Description: International Food Hall
Comments: Adjacent to the Super G Mart in Pineville (they’re connected inside). Large space with lots of food stalls, similar to Optimist Hall and Urban District Market, except all the spots are Asian food/culture focused. You can get coffee/tea from Tous les Jours inside Super G Mart or from Honeycow inside the actual hall. They have QR codes on the walls that allow you to order from any place within for pick up. Plenty of places to sit down, outdoor patio, free Wi-Fi, but limited access to outlets, so if you bring a laptop, come charged up.

Description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of The Bowl at Ballantyne, a captivating destination where culinary delights, enriching experiences, and natural beauty converge. Stroll along the picturesque stream park, savor delectable flavors at a diverse array of eateries, and indulge in pampering services that elevate your every day. Discover a world of endless possibilities at The Bowl, where every moment is crafted to inspire and delight.
Comments: Fly Kid Fly and The Salty offer free Wi-Fi, coffee, and limited indoor seating. The whole area is an outdoor marketplace with plenty of seating, stores, and spots to hangout.

Address: 100 N Tryon St Suite 270, Charlotte, NC 28202
Description: Coffeehouse chain serving signature drinks, mochas & lattes, plus coffee & breakfast.
Comments: A great place to hangout enroute to exploring the Overstreet Mall. Work a bit from here, then hit the walkway around the corner (towards the post office and small library) to explore the rest of Uptown from indoors. Caribou has great sandwiches, and an extra large size for hot drinks that's larger than the Starbucks Venti. The tea's really good. This spot has limited inside seating, but there's a ton of seating outside in Founders Hall. This actual space is small, but the building its' in is huge. Founders Hall has a beautiful atrium and many seating options with great views of the city.

Description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.
Comments: A small library with a big space for kids, limited general seating, but a nice space regardless. Very nice staff.

Address: 8440 Pit Stop Ct NW #180, Concord, NC 28027
Description: A friendly and welcoming tabletop game store for enthusiasts and novices alike.
Comments:
A community submission. Located in a strip mall adjacent to Concord Mills. They have beer, wine, various cold drinks, and a small snack shop. Check their website for tournaments and events. No charge to just come in and play. If you can find an open table, you can plop down and hangout.

If you’re into Dungeons & Dragons, Warhammer 40k, Magic the Gathering, and the like, this is your third place. You’ll find your people here. On my first visit there was well over 30 people all together playing a board game I wasn’t familiar with, but they were plenty happy. The essence of a third place is community. If you’re role playing board game level nerdy (I’m more of a computer and anime nerd myself), this is your home base!

Description: Large supermarket chain with deli & bakery departments, plus health & beauty aids.
Comments: There's a Starbucks downstairs with a decent amount of seating, but what makes this a third place is the upstairs area with even more seating, a huge outdoor patio, and a bar. The outdoor patio is so large you can almost certainly always get a corner to yourself, but bring noise canceling headphones if you sit outside, it’s right above a busy street. The restrooms are upstairs making it convenient. Harris Teeter's is interesting in that some locations are just a grocery store, and others are like a grocery store and community hangout spot with a bar, hot food, Starbucks, plenty of seating, etc. This is the latter.

Address: 414 Tom Hall St, Fort Mill, SC 29715
Description:
We’re a local family-owned coffee shop nestled close to downtown Fort Mill, SC. We’re a local hangout spot where people could chill, work, and have meaningful conversations.

We’ve got a wide variety of drinks, from seasonal lattes to classic black coffee. We also offer a variety of loose-leaf tea, Matcha & Chai. We also sell our freshly roasted coffee beans and delicious pastries from Whisk & Wood (Charlotte, NC) and Poppyseed Kitchen (Fort Mill, SC).

We started roasting coffee in our garage back in 2019 and then expanded to selling at local farmers markets. Our coffee shop finally opened in 2023, and we’re thrilled to serve the greater Fort Mill community!
Comments: Good access to outlets along the wall. They have cinnamon rolls sometimes 👏🏾🔥. Modern coffee shop vibes in what looks like a converted space. There’s nice artwork on the walls from local artists you can buy to support them. They have unique tea options, the Organic Blue Ginger is particularly good.

Description: Food stalls, public art, shops & events in a complex once used as a car factory & military depot.
Comments: This is a large outdoor area with many indoor stores within its boundaries. You've got food, lot's of outdoor seating, outdoor Wi-Fi, Hex Coffee Shop on site if you want to chill indoors. There's all sorts of events happening here on a regular basis, check their website for more details.

Address: 6500 S New Hope Rd, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: The Trailhead Store is the on-site coffee house of the Daniel Stowe Conservancy, which does not require membership or admission to utilize. It includes upstairs working space and a covered screened in porch that is popular with remote workers seeking a change of pace from working from home. The Trailhead Store also often hosts events free to the public, such as our Pickin' on the Porch music series and outdoor yoga.
Comments: A community submission. Located within the grounds of the Daniel Stowe Conservancy. You can work/study then explore the gardens and hiking trails. All seating is outside in a covered patio and then various fully outdoor seating options around the store (including a nice gazebo) and throughout the grounds of the gardens. So, a great option for a warm day.

Address: 6500 S New Hope Rd, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: The Daniel Stowe Conservancy is a non-profit public garden with an on-site coffee house, the Trailhead Store, which does not require membership or admission to utilize. The Trailhead Store includes upstairs working space and a covered screened in porch that is popular with remote workers seeking a change of pace from working from home. The Trailhead Store also often hosts events free to the public, such as our Pickin' on the Porch music series and outdoor yoga. In the Garden we have many tables and areas you can work, relax, catch up with friends/family and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. We also have miles of trails on the property to enjoy which are also accessible without an admission fee.
Comments: A community submission. While the outdoor gardens themselves don't have Wi-Fi, the coffee shop on site called The Trailhead Store does. You can hangout from the shop, work, study, get something to drink, and then walk around the gardens. Sounds like a great day!

Address: 3701 N Davidson St Suite #203, Charlotte, NC 28205
Description: An arts-focused craft brewery, lounge and performance space. Plenty of room for working alone or sprawling with friends. In addition to beer, has a wide variety of alternative beverages including house-made alcohol free drinks like craft sodas and caffeinated hop water.
Comments: A community submission, they have cinnamon sugar pretzels, so not quite cinnamon rolls, but just about the next best thing!

Description: We are Belmont Bookshop, a community-focused bookshop and gathering space located on historic Main Street in Belmont, NC about 15 miles south of Charlotte in Gaston County. Come on in and stay a while!
Comments:
A community submission. They have game nights, book clubs, space to hang out, coffee, alcohol, etc. It’s a proper small local bookstore, complete with the decor and trappings typically associated with such, as in it feels very authentic.

The seating is mostly individual chairs interspersed throughout for easy sit & read access. There’s Wi-Fi but I think you’re better off enjoying the bookstore vibes here than trying to whip out your laptop and work (limited outlet access). There’s a lovely gentle dog that hangs around the shop sometimes as well. A good boy indeed.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

Comments: This is the nicest Barnes & Noble in the Charlotte area. It's pristine. A rather large Starbucks seating section compared to other locations with excellent outlet access. The bookstore itself is well arranged so that genre areas feel tucked away in corners with random chairs here and there. Tall ceilings give the building an airy feel, even when busy, doesn't feel crowded. The location is convenient too, plenty of shopping to be had in Concord Mills after chilling here.

Description: Eco-minded chain with natural & organic grocery items, housewares & other products (most sell wine).

Provided Coffee Concord is a mega-cafe located next to Nothing New Vintage, behind Southern Strain Brewing. We are proud to be one of the largest coffee shops in NC! We serve an assortment of handcrafted espresso beverages and bottled drinks.

Founded by two best friends at 18 years old, Provided aims to create an atmosphere of community wherever travelled. As coffee can act as a bridge of connection between others, the customer can expect "special experiences in unusual places."
Comments:
Huge space in a converted industrial building that’s shared with a thrift store. A quintessential example of the industrial chic aesthetic. I love it. The wooden floors creak as you walk around, there’s still a bit of that old building smell, very well-done space. 

They managed to provide fairly good access to outlets with the redesign, although it’s not abundant, so charge your laptop before coming. Follow the signs if you’re struggling to find the entrance, it can get confusing as there’s also a brewery nearby.

Description: Welcome to Coffee Republic Matthews, your go-to coffee shop since 2019! We serve roasted coffee, handcrafted drinks, and fresh bakery treats in a cozy shop. As passionate coffee roasters, we bring you the finest brews to fuel your day. Stop by today!
Comments: Small but nice spot. Most of the seating is bar style chairs across a shelf like table across a wall. The food is good. There’s a rather large Goodwill nearby so if you’re into thrifting you can make it a whole trip.

Description: Coffee Republic & Bakery is a charming establishment located in Cornelius, North Carolina. This bakery and coffee shop is a local favorite. It provides a cozy and welcoming atmosphere where customers can enjoy a wide range of treats and beverages.

Coffee Republic & Coworking – Huntersville is the best coffee shop near you for work and relaxation. Enjoy premium coffee, fresh pastries from our bakery, and a modern coworking space. Stay productive while savoring the best coffee in town!

A really cool coffee shop in old town Cornelius with a cozy local vibe. We serve locally roasted craft coffee and exotic loose leaf teas along with Breakfast and lunch fare made in house, and amazing scrumptious baked goods.
Comments:
Lots of tea options, coffee, food, and pastries in a small but bright and inviting space. Good access to outlets, most seating along the walls can access some. Has all the menu options and amenities of trendy new age coffee shops but keeps the homey local spot decor and atmosphere. 

A very clean place. Great music, perhaps that’s just a coincidence related to the playlist selected by the staff when I visited, but it twas 🔥. It’s small enough that everyone can hear your conversation if you’ve got a strong voice, so don’t come here to discuss super secrets, but it’s an excellent choice for working, studying, reading, meeting friends, chilling, etc. 

If you fancy a walk, a very nice trail, the Antiquity Greenway, is right down the street. You can grab your drink and head outside to touch grass.

Address: 9705 Sam Furr Rd ste a, Huntersville, NC 28078
Description: Waterbean Coffee was the first specialty coffee shop in the Lake Norman area that offered pour-over, French Press, Aeropress, and over 5 different espresso single origin or blends for our customers to choose from.
Comments:
This is my second favorite of all the Waterbean locations (the Pineville location is still my number one). It feels so cozy, spread out, tons of seating, has a fireplace (not sure if it's real or just for decoration, but I like that it's there). Never seen it get overwhelmingly busy here. Quite lovely.

The Waterbean Special sandwich is amazing, and I continue to love their dedication to providing an abundance of loose-leaf herbal tea options. Waterbean was the first coffee shop I visited after moving to Charlotte in 2020 (man, it's been so long!), so they have a soft spot in my heart. I'm happy to see them expanded to the greater Charlotte area.

Description:
Summit Coffee brings award-winning craft coffee to a beautifully designed café, highlighted by tons of outdoor seating and natural light. This family-friendly store features a full coffee and espresso bar, plus draft beer, wine, locally baked pastries and more.

Summit Coffee's Birkdale store will feature live music, other events and much more.
Upscale grocery store chain with an old-world vibe offers local produce, prepared eats, wine & more.
Comments: The seating section here is in a corner of the store by the checkout. This is a really nice neighborhood and fancy store, even fancier than Whole Foods. If you’ve ever been to Wegmans, it’s kind of on that level. The store itself is large but the seating section is medium sized. Free Wi-Fi, seating with good access to outlets, a microwave to warm up food you buy from the store, cinnamon rolls 🔥, restrooms right by the seating area, and coffee/tea (in front of the cold bistro meals case). This place is a low key gem.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

Comments:
There's parking right behind the building and more in a nearby garage that serves all businesses in the area. They have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯. Sort of a fancy cabin aesthetic to the place. Doesn’t feel crowded, there’s enough space to spread out and feel comfortable, particularly on warm days as there’s plenty of outdoor seating. 

The door in the back that leads to the restrooms also takes you to Goldberry Books, so you can grab a drink, pick up a book, and have plenty of seating options between the two places.

Description: More than 30 arcade games headline this modern spot serving craft beers, cocktails & sodas.

Comments: There's a free parking lot down the street by the Pineville Police Department building. You will find your people here if you’re into D&D, Warhammer 40k, Yu-Gi-Oh, and the like. The store has a Discord (link on their website) where they organize meet ups and games. You can book the space anytime as well if you are looking for a place to host a game. They sell snacks, drinks, and beer, and there’s restaurants across the street, so you can grab food, bring it in, and stay for a while.

Description: Heist Brewery and Barrel Arts is the second location for Charlotte based Heist Brewery. Featuring a spacious taproom that will be utilized to feature small batch barrel aged offerings, as well as primary brews such as CitraQuench'l and Blurred is the Word. We also are the home of Livy's Neapolitan Pizzeria, open every day that Barrel Arts is. Come enjoy a beer or two, grab a pizza, and relax.
Comments: Plenty of space to spread out and find your corner. Limited outlet though so come charged up.

Description: Specialty coffee shop from a local Charlotte roaster serving carefully crafted espresso drinks, drip coffee, and rotating single origin offerings, along with a small selection of pastries. Known for consistent quality, attention to detail, and baristas who can help you choose something new, it is a reliable stop whether you are grabbing a quick coffee or exploring more adventurous seasonal drinks.
Comments: Right across from a light rail stop, so easy access for those who live on the line and don’t want to drive here. It’s in the bottom of an apartment building, so plenty of traffic during peak hours. Parking is free if you can find a street spot, which might be tough given that  apartment residents and their guests usually have those spots. There’s a paid very small gravel lot nearby though. Excellent, like 10/10 Super Saiyan god level access to outlets. Very well designed. You can show up with your battery on E and you should be alright. The bagels are really good, and the hot tea options. I’m sure the coffee is as well, but I’m a tea guy.

They have a mini market with a good selection of Korean foods and candies. The owner of the market is Korean, so there’s some inspiration from his culture throughout the market. See if you can find the Ritz Crackers with cream between them (like an Oreo, but with Ritz) in the store. I promise it tastes better than it sounds. There’s a coffee shop within the market in addition to plenty of food stalls. The tables have outlets embedded into them so you can stay charged up. Fast free wifi, check the napkin holders for the password. Great remote work spot.

Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. This spot is plenty large. If you need a place to work or study, and want a guarantee of seating and good outlet access, this is a solid choice.

Address: 139 E Main St, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: Coffee. Culture. Community. Good because we care.
Cheery regional coffeehouse chain serving specialty drinks, smoothies & baked goods.
Comments: I’d say this is most similar to a small Caribou Coffee. Coffee, tea, food, pastries, and a drive thru. This location is new (as of 2024) and very clean as a result. Also, I'm like 70% sure they get their sandwiches from the same place as Caribou Coffee, they're great. Not a ton of seating, so if you drive here and can't find a spot, drive up the street to the Pineville Library or Waterbean Pineville for more options.

Address: 526 John Ross Pkwy Suite #101, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. Nothing remarkable, but certainly passable.

Address: 153 E White St, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: Community centered, family-owned, mercantile & café bar in Downtown Rock Hill, SC.
Comments: It's a massive general store full of cool trinkets, gifts, and a laid-back, folksy vibe. The kind of place you can wander through for a while and still find something new each time. Inside, there's also a coffee shop tucked into the corner, perfect for grabbing a drink while you browse. The whole area makes for a great day trip, with other spots like Knowledge Perk, Rock Hill Coffee, Amelie's Rock Hill, and plenty of local shops within walking distance. If you're looking to wind down, end your day at nearby Fountain Park with a good book and something warm to drink. You’ll feel like you’re in a movie, one of those they used to always cast Drew Barrymore in.

Place: Knowledge Perk Coffee Company | Fort Mill
Description:
Come relax in our beautiful café with indoor and outdoor seating. We offer freshly roasted coffee, cold brew, full range of expert espresso beverages, and a variety of sweet and savory pastries and bagel creations.

Thursday-Friday from 4:00pm-9:30pm, and Saturday from 6:00pm-9:30pm, we turn into Knowledge Perk "After Hours," serving coffee, original cocktails, beer, and wine.

We are a coffee roaster and beans are available onsite or via our website for retail purchase. We have immersive, engaging programs and events for our community to grow in their knowledge and enjoyment of coffee. Give us a call or visit our website for more information. Better yet, drop by to see us in person!
Comments: The cinnamon rolls. My friend, the cinnamon rolls, they are exceptional. They only have a limited amount, usually available in the morning until they’re sold out, but the cinnamon rolls are marvelous. If you're able to withstand feelings of gluttony or social anxiety stemming from the thought that the barista is judging you (they're not), order two. Eat one right away, warm the other one up when you get home. That's how to properly evaluate a cinnamon roll. You must have it in both states, as each is valid in its own right.
